intro: Exomiocarpon madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
